benchmark_details.name: E-ANT (Efficient Automatic GUI NavigaTion)
benchmark_details.overview: The E-ANT dataset is the first large-scale Chinese dataset for GUI navigation that contains real human behavior and high-quality screenshots with annotations, including over 40,000 user operation trajectories across more than 20,000 distinct tiny apps and URLs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating GUI navigation and LLM/MLLM decision-making capabilities, specifically in the context of Chinese mobile applications.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data is annotated in an environment that may not fully represent real mobile device interactions.

data.source: Collected from diverse tiny-apps, which are lightweight and simple to develop mobile applications.
data.annotation: Annotated through interactions of human annotators with the GUI.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the congruence between model decisions and observed actions in the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in navigating GUI tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline results are reported for various models tested on the dataset.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through extensive testing of mainstream models under different strategies.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes a diverse array of tiny apps from different developers, indicating variety in design logic and styles.
